#Text=Face Your Shadow
#Text=In Jungian psychology , the " Shadow " is an archetype that represents the unconscious " dark side " of an individual or group .

column3:
abstract[6]	new[6]	_	_
2-17	106-110	dark	abstract[6]	new[6]	_	_
2-18	111-115	side	abstract[6]	new[6]	_	_
2-19	116-117

column1: #Text=This side is often composed of repressed , disowned , unrecognized , or unexpressed needs , feelings , and personality traits .

#Text=Sometimes , in the process of stuffing things away ( to either cope with a trauma or become more acceptable to others ) , we bury positive things about ourselves as well as negative - like a talent , etc.
#Text=The longer we continue to repress or refuse to acknowledge or integrate this side into our conscious ego , the meaner it gets .
#Text=From there , it begins to affect our relationships with others by causing us to project our negative ( or even positive ) qualities onto them .
#Text=The " Shadow " is similar to the " id " in Sigmund Freud 's model of the psyche .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Figure out who in your life you project on the most - this may be the closest person to you , whom you spend a lot of time with or it can be your " epitome of evil " in society .

9-39	1003-1004

column1: #Text=List all the qualities about this person or group of people that you despise or feel jealous , judgmental , or afraid of .
#Text=Think of the ways that you display those same qualities or traits .
#Text=It can be in different contexts or to a lesser degree , or maybe you even wish you could be like that .
#Text=Keep acknowledging and taking responsibility for your Shadow .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Use The Arts to create " dark " stories , poetry , music , drawings , paintings , movies , etc.
#Text=Start with a conscious decision to do it for the purpose of Shadow Work .
#Text=That means you 'll need to go back and read , listen , or look later .
#Text=Pay attention to the " shadowy " creatures and themes as well as any " villains " , if applicable .
#Text=What are they like ?
#Text=How are they similar to you ?
#Text=Do you wish you could do the things they do if you knew you 'd get away with it ?
#Text=Pay attention to your dreams ; write them down if you remember them .
#Text=Pay close attention to the feelings and thoughts involved and how you act on them .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Shadow Work is n't easy and you may feel very uncomfortable with what you find lurking there .
#Text=The more you resist accepting that it is a part of you , the stronger and longer ' it ' will fight with you .
#Text=Individuals with certain " high conflict " personality disorders are prone to projection and will often accuse their targets of the same .
#Text=Everyone projects to some degree , but a disordered mind usually wo n't take any steps to integrate their Shadow as they 're content to let others to carry that baggage for them .
#Text=Once you start , there 's no going back .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Courage
#Text=Objectivity ( maybe a trusted friend can help with this )
#Text=Supplies/Equipment for writing , art , or music
